gov.nasa.worldwind.util
Class BufferWrapper

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.worldwind.util.BufferWrapper
Direct Known Subclasses:
BufferWrapper.AbstractBufferWrapper
public abstract class BufferWrapper
extends Object

BufferWrapper provides an interface for reading and writing primitive data to and from data buffers, without having to know the underlying data type. BufferWrapper may be backed by a primitive data buffer of any type.

Method Detail

getBackingBuffer

public abstract Buffer getBackingBuffer()
Returns the buffer's backing data sture. For the standard BufferWrapper types (ByteBufferWrapper, ShortBufferWrapper, IntBufferWrapper, FloatBufferWrapper, and DoubleBufferWrapper), this returns the backing Buffer.

Returns:
the backing data store.

getSubBuffer

public abstract BufferWrapper getSubBuffer(int index,
                                           int length)
Returns a new BufferWrapper which is a subsequence of this buffer. The new buffer starts with the value at the specified index, and has the specified length. The two buffers share the same backing store, so changes to this buffer are reflected in the new buffer, and visa versa.

Parameters:
index - the new buffer's starting index.
length - the new buffer's length.
Returns:
a subsequence of this buffer.

length

public abstract int length()
Returns the length of the buffer, in units of the underlying data type (e.g. bytes, shorts, ints, floats, doubles).

Returns:
the buffer's length.

public abstract void putByte(int index,

Sets the value at the specified index as a byte. The byte is cast to the underlying data type.

value - the byte value to be set.

putSubBuffer

public abstract void putSubBuffer(int index,
                                  BufferWrapper buffer)
Sets a subsequence of this buffer with the contents of the specified buffer. The subsequence to set starts with the value at the specified index, and has length equal to the specified buffer's length.

Parameters:
index - the starting index to set.
buffer - the buffer.

validateByteOrder

validateDataType

protected static boolean validateDataType(Object o)

wrap

public static BufferWrapper wrap(ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                                 AVList parameters)
Wraps the specified ByteBuffer with a BufferWrapper according to the specified parameters. The byteBuffer is interpreted according to values found in the parameters. AVKey.BYTE_ORDER specifies the byteBuffer's byte ordering,. and AVKey.DATA_TYPE specifies type of data store in the byteBuffer: shorts, ints, or floats.

Parameters:
byteBuffer - the buffer to wrap.
parameters - the parameters which describe how to interpret the buffer.
Returns:
a new BufferWrapper backed by the specified byteBuffer.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if either the byteBuffer or parameters are null, or if the parameters do not completely describe how to interpret the byteBuffer.
